item.title: Credit Cards
item.description:
Credit Cards for Pet Travelers ğŸ’³

The right credit card can get you 2-5 free hotel nights just from the sign-up bonus. Here’s how to pick the best one for traveling with your dog.

ğŸ¯ Not Sure Where to Start?

Take the quiz â€” it matches you with the right card based on your dog’s size, travel frequency, and budget:

Take the Quiz: Which Hotel Credit Card Is Right for You?

7 questions, personalized recommendation

ğŸ“Š Card Comparisons

Full breakdowns of every card worth considering:

  • Best Credit Cards for Pet Travelers (2025) â€” Complete comparison of Hilton, IHG, Marriott, and Chase cards
  • Best Credit Card Bonuses (December 2025) â€” This month’s best sign-up offers

ğŸ’ Hilton Cards

Hilton has the best credit card lineup for pet travelers:

  • Hilton Credit Card Quiz â€” Find your perfect Hilton card
  • Hilton Diamond Status Guide â€” How cards can get you top-tier status
  • Why Hilton for Pet Travelers â€” Why Hilton cards are worth it

The Hilton lineup:

Card Annual Fee Sign-Up Bonus Best For
Hilton Honors (No Fee) $0 100,000 pts Beginners
Hilton Surpass $150 155,000 pts Most travelers
Hilton Aspire $550 175,000 pts Frequent travelers

ğŸ¨ IHG Cards (For Kimpton)

If you have a large dog, IHG cards get you free stays at Kimpton â€” the only major chain with no weight limits:

  • How to Book Kimpton Free with Points â€” Includes IHG card breakdown

The IHG lineup:

Card Annual Fee Sign-Up Bonus Best For
IHG Traveler $0 80,000 pts No commitment
IHG Premier $99 140,000 pts Regular Kimpton stays

ğŸ”„ Flexible Points (Chase)

Want flexibility across multiple hotel chains? Chase points transfer to IHG, Hyatt, Marriott, and airlines:

  • Chase Sapphire Preferred â€” $95/year, 60,000 point bonus, transfers 1:1 to IHG

ğŸ¢ Marriott Cards

Marriott has the best sign-up bonus â€” 3 free nights right out of the gate:

  • Marriott Bonvoy Boundless â€” $95/year, 3 free nights (up to 50K points each)

Note: Marriott pet policies vary more by property than Hilton. Always call ahead.

ğŸ“… Monthly Bonus Updates

Sign-up bonuses change frequently. I track the best current offers:

  • Best Credit Card Bonuses (December 2025) â€” Updated monthly

â“ Common Questions

Which card should I get first? If you’re new to points, start with the no-annual-fee Hilton card. Zero risk, 100,000 points, and you can upgrade later.

Are annual fees worth it? Usually yes. The Hilton Surpass costs $150/year but gives you $200 in Hilton credits â€” you come out ahead before counting the points.

Do I need good credit? Most travel cards require good to excellent credit (700+). If you’re building credit, start with a regular cash-back card first.

Have questions about which card is right for you? Reach out â€” happy to help.

item.title: Guides
item.description:
Your Guide to Free Pet Travel ğŸ¾

These guides cover everything from choosing the right hotel chain to earning enough points for free stays. Start wherever makes sense for you.

ğŸš€ Start Here

New to points travel? Start with these:

  • Start Here â€” The complete step-by-step path for beginners
  • Free Guide (PDF) â€” Download my 4-page quickstart guide

ğŸ¨ Hotel Pet Policies

Know before you book â€” weight limits, fees, and what to expect:

  • Hilton Pet Policy 2025 â€” Fees, weight limits & tips for every Hilton brand
  • Kimpton Pet Policy 2025 â€” No fees, no weight limits, no restrictions
  • IHG Pet Policy Guide â€” Full breakdown of IHG brands including Kimpton
  • Traveling with a Large Dog â€” Hotel options when your dog is 50+ lbs
  • Hotel Pet Policy Finder â€” Interactive tool to check any chain

ğŸ’ Hilton for Pet Travelers

Hilton is my go-to for dog travel. Here’s how to maximize it:

  • Why Hilton Is Best for Pet Travelers â€” Why I’m loyal to Hilton
  • Hilton Diamond Status Guide â€” How to get top-tier perks without staying 60 nights
  • Hilton Credit Card Quiz â€” Find your perfect Hilton card in 2 minutes

ğŸï¸ IHG & Kimpton for Large Dogs

If your dog is over 75 lbs, Kimpton should be on your radar:

  • How to Book Kimpton Free with Points â€” Step-by-step guide to free Kimpton stays
  • IHG Pet Policy Guide â€” All IHG brands compared

ğŸš— Road Trip Essentials

Practical stuff for getting there with your pup:

  • Road Trip Essentials for Dogs â€” My packing list for traveling with a 70-lb dog
  • Jacksonville to Panama City Beach â€” A pet-friendly road trip guide
  • Best Pet-Friendly Beach Towns Near Jacksonville â€” Weekend getaways with your dog

ğŸ”§ Tools

Interactive tools to help you decide:

  • Hotel Credit Card Quiz â€” Find the best card for your dog’s size and travel style
  • Hilton Credit Card Quiz â€” Hilton-specific recommendations
  • Hotel Pet Policy Finder â€” Check policies for any major chain

Have a question I haven’t covered? Reach out â€” I’m always adding new guides based on what people ask.

item.title: Tools
item.description:
Tools for Pet Travelers ğŸ”§

These interactive tools help you make decisions faster â€” find the right credit card, check pet policies, and plan your trips.

ğŸ’³ Credit Card Quizzes

Not sure which hotel credit card to get? These quizzes match you with the right card based on your situation:

Which Hotel Credit Card Is Right for You? Covers Hilton, IHG, Marriott, and Chase â€” 7 questions, personalized result

Which Hilton Card Is Right for You? Hilton-specific â€” compares all 4 Hilton Amex cards

ğŸ¨ Hotel Pet Policy Finder

Quickly check pet policies for any major hotel chain â€” weight limits, fees, and whether your dog is welcome:

Hotel Pet Policy Finder Select a chain, see the policy instantly

ğŸ“¥ Free Download

Free Guide: How to Book Free Hotel Stays with Your Dog A 4-page PDF covering everything you need to know â€” which cards to get, which hotels welcome dogs, and how to book your first free stay.

ğŸ› ï¸ More Tools Coming

I’m working on more tools to make pet travel easier:

  • Point calculator (how many points do you need?)
  • Trip cost comparison (points vs. cash)
  • Dog-friendly destination finder

Have an idea for a tool? Let me know what would help you.

item.title: Trip Reports
item.description:
Trip Reports ğŸ¾

These are real trips I’ve taken with Ansel, my 70-lb GSP/Lab mix. Each report covers the hotel, the destination, and how I used points to book it free.

ğŸ–ï¸ Florida Trips

Panama City Beach: Embassy Suites Review 5 nights at Embassy Suites, booked entirely on Hilton points. Ocean-view suite upgrade, Dog Beach access, and Pier Park right next door. Pet fee: $125 for 5+ nights.

ğŸ“ Coming Soon

I’m planning more trips with Ansel â€” check back for new reports:

  • Kimpton property review (first Kimpton stay!)
  • More Florida beach destinations
  • Road trips beyond Florida

ğŸ—ºï¸ Related Guides

Planning your own trip? These might help:

  • Jacksonville to Panama City Beach Road Trip â€” The drive, the stops, what to pack
  • Best Pet-Friendly Beach Towns Near Jacksonville â€” Weekend getaways within a few hours
  • Road Trip Essentials for Dogs â€” My packing list

ğŸ“¸ Want to Share Your Trip?

I’d love to feature your pet travel wins! If you’ve used points to book a dog-friendly hotel stay, tell me about it:

Leave Your Pawprint â†’

Your story could be featured on the Pawprints page.

Have a destination you want me to check out? Let me know â€” I’m always looking for the next trip.
